00052 typedef struct xnarch_stack {
00053     struct xnarch_stack *next;

00055 
00056 typedef struct xnarchtcb {      /* Per-thread arch-dependent block */
00057 
00058     /* Kernel mode side */
00059 
00060     unsigned long *espp;        /* Pointer to ESP backup area (&esp or
00061                                    &user->thread.esp).
00062                                    DONT MOVE THIS MEMBER,
00063                                    switch_to depends on it. */
00064 
00065     struct ia64_fpreg fpuenv[96]; /* FIXME FPU: check if alignment constraints
00066                                      are needed. */
00067     
00068     unsigned stacksize;         /* Aligned size of stack (bytes) */
00069     xnarch_stack_t *stackbase;   /* Stack space */
00070     unsigned long esp;          /* Saved ESP for kernel-based threads */
00071 
00072     /* User mode side */
00073 
00074     struct task_struct *user_task;      /* Shadowed user-space task */
00075     struct task_struct *active_task;    /* Active user-space task */
00076 
00077     struct ia64_fpreg *fpup;
00078 #define xnarch_fpu_ptr(tcb)     ((tcb)->fpup)
00079 
00080 } xnarchtcb_t;
00081 
00082 int xnarch_alloc_stack(xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00083                        unsigned stacksize);
00084 
00085 void xnarch_free_stack(xnarchtcb_t *tcb);

00090     unsigned trap;
00091 
00092 } xnarch_fltinfo_t;

00094 #define xnarch_fault_trap(fi)  ((fi)->trap)
00095 #define xnarch_fault_code(fi)  ((fi)->ia64.isr)
00096 #define xnarch_fault_pc(fi)    ((fi)->ia64.regs->cr_iip)
00097 /* Fault is caused by use of FPU while FPU disabled. */
00098 #define xnarch_fault_fpu_p(fi) ((fi)->trap == ADEOS_FPDIS_TRAP)
00099 /* The following predicates are only usable over a regular Linux stack
00100    context. */
00101 #define xnarch_fault_pf_p(fi)   ((fi)->trap == ADEOS_PF_TRAP)
00102 #define xnarch_fault_bp_p(fi)   ((current->ptrace & PT_PTRACED) && \
00103                                  (fi)->trap == ADEOS_DEBUG_TRAP)
00104 #define xnarch_fault_notify(fi) (!xnarch_fault_bp_p(fi))

00110 static inline void *xnarch_sysalloc (u_long bytes)
00111 
00112 {
00113     if (bytes >= 128*1024)
00114         return vmalloc(bytes);
00115 
00116     return kmalloc(bytes,GFP_KERNEL);
00117 }
00118 
00119 static inline void xnarch_sysfree (void *chunk, u_long bytes)
00120 
00121 {
00122     if (bytes >= 128*1024)
00123         vfree(chunk);
00124     else
00125         kfree(chunk);
00126 }

00128 static inline void xnarch_relay_tick (void)
00129 
00130 {
00131 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00132     rthal_send_ipi(RTHAL_HOST_TIMER_IRQ, cpu_online_map);
00133 #else /* ! CONFIG_SMP */
00134     rthal_trigger_irq(RTHAL_HOST_TIMER_IRQ);
00135 #endif
00136 }

00144 static inline int xnarch_start_timer (unsigned long ns,
00145                                       void (*tickhandler)(void))
00146 {
00147     int err = rthal_timer_request(tickhandler,ns);
00148     rthal_declare_cpuid;
00149     long long delta;
00150 
00151     if (err)
00152         return err;
00153 
00154     rthal_load_cpuid();
00155     delta = rthal_itm_next[cpuid] - ia64_get_itc();
00156     
00157     return delta < 0LL ? 0LL : xnarch_tsc_to_ns(delta);
00158 }
00159 
00160 static inline void xnarch_leave_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb)
00161 
00162 {
00163     struct task_struct *fpu_owner
00164         = (struct task_struct *)ia64_get_kr(IA64_KR_FPU_OWNER);
00165     rthal_declare_cpuid;
00166 
00167     rthal_load_cpuid();
00168 
00169     __set_bit(cpuid,&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00170     /* Remember the preempted Linux task pointer. */
00171     rootcb->user_task = rootcb->active_task = rthal_root_host_task(cpuid);
00172     /* So that xnarch_save_fpu() will operate on the right FPU area. */
00173     rootcb->fpup = fpu_owner ? fpu_owner->thread.fph : NULL;
00174 }
00175 
00176 static inline void xnarch_enter_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb)
00177 {
00178     __clear_bit(xnarch_current_cpu(),&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00179 }
00180 
00181 static inline void xnarch_switch_to (xnarchtcb_t *out_tcb,
00182                                      xnarchtcb_t *in_tcb)
00183 {
00184     struct task_struct *outproc = out_tcb->active_task;
00185     struct task_struct *inproc = in_tcb->user_task;
00186 
00187     in_tcb->active_task = inproc ?: outproc;
00188 
00189     if (inproc && inproc != outproc)
00190         {
00191         /* We are switching to a user task different from the last
00192            preempted or running user task, so that we can use the
00193            Linux context switch routine. */
00194         struct mm_struct *oldmm = outproc->active_mm;
00195         struct task_struct *last;
00196 
00197         switch_mm(oldmm,inproc->active_mm,inproc);
00198 
00199         if (!inproc->mm)
00200             enter_lazy_tlb(oldmm,inproc);
00201 
00202         __switch_to(outproc, inproc, last);
00203         }
00204     else
00205         {
00206         /* Use our own light switch routine. */
00207         unsigned long gp;
00208 
00209         ia64_stop();
00210         gp = ia64_getreg(_IA64_REG_GP);
00211         ia64_stop();
00212         rthal_switch_context(out_tcb,in_tcb);
00213         ia64_stop();
00214         ia64_setreg(_IA64_REG_GP, gp);
00215         ia64_stop();
00216 
00217         /* fph will be enabled by xnarch_restore_fpu if needed, and
00218            returns the root thread in its usual mode. */
00219         ia64_fph_disable();
00220         }
00221 }
00222 
00223 static inline void xnarch_finalize_and_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb,
00224                                                xnarchtcb_t *next_tcb)
00225 {
00226     xnarch_switch_to(dead_tcb,next_tcb);
00227 }
00228 
00229 static inline void xnarch_finalize_no_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb)
00230 
00231 {
00232     /* Empty */
00233 }
00234 
00235 #define fph2task(faddr)                                 \
00236     ((struct task_struct *)((char *) (faddr) -          \
00237                             (size_t) &((struct task_struct *) 0)->thread.fph[0]))
00238 
00239 #define xnarch_fpu_init_p(task) ((task)->thread.flags & IA64_THREAD_FPH_VALID)
00240 
00241 static inline void xnarch_init_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00242 
00243 {
00244     struct task_struct *task = tcb->user_task;
00245     /* Initialize the FPU for a task. This must be run on behalf of the
00246        task. */
00247     ia64_fph_enable();
00248     __ia64_init_fpu();
00249     /* The mfh bit is automatically armed, since the init_fpu routine
00250        modifies the FPH registers. */
00251 
00252     if(task)
00253         /* Real-time shadow FPU initialization: setting the mfh bit in saved
00254           registers, xnarch_save_fpu will finish the work. Since tcb is the tcb
00255           of a shadow, no need to check: task == fph2task(tcb->fpup). */
00256         ia64_psr(ia64_task_regs(task))->mfh = 1;
00257 }
00258 
00259 static inline void xnarch_save_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00260 {
00261     unsigned long lpsr = ia64_getreg(_IA64_REG_PSR);
00262     struct ia64_psr *current_psr = (struct ia64_psr *) &lpsr;
00263     
00264     if (current_psr->mfh)
00265         {
00266         if(tcb->user_task && tcb->fpup)
00267             {
00268             struct task_struct *linux_fpu_owner = fph2task(tcb->fpup);
00269             struct ia64_psr *psr = ia64_psr(ia64_task_regs(linux_fpu_owner));
00270 
00271             /* Keep the FPU save zone in sync with what Linux expects. */
00272             psr->mfh = 0;
00273             linux_fpu_owner->thread.flags |= IA64_THREAD_FPH_VALID;
00274             }
00275 
00276         ia64_fph_enable();
00277         __ia64_save_fpu(tcb->fpup);
00278         ia64_rsm(IA64_PSR_MFH);
00279         ia64_srlz_d();
00280         }
00281 }
00282 
00283 static inline void xnarch_restore_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00284 
00285 {
00286     struct task_struct *linux_fpu_owner;
00287     int need_disabled_fph;
00288 
00289     if (tcb->user_task && tcb->fpup)
00290         {
00291         linux_fpu_owner = fph2task(tcb->fpup);
00292 
00293         if(!xnarch_fpu_init_p(linux_fpu_owner))
00294             return;     /* Uninit fpu area -- do not restore. */
00295 
00296         /* Disable fph, if we are not switching back to the task which
00297            owns the FPU. */
00298         need_disabled_fph = linux_fpu_owner != tcb->user_task;
00299         }
00300     else
00301         need_disabled_fph = 0;
00302 
00303     /* Restore the FPU hardware with valid fp registers from a
00304        user-space or kernel thread. */
00305     ia64_fph_enable();
00306     __ia64_load_fpu(tcb->fpup);
00307     ia64_rsm(IA64_PSR_MFH);
00308     ia64_srlz_d();
00309 
00310     if(need_disabled_fph)
00311         ia64_fph_disable();
00312 }
00313 
00314 
00315 static inline void xnarch_enable_fpu(xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00316 {
00317     if (tcb->user_task && tcb->fpup && fph2task(tcb->fpup) != tcb->user_task)
00318         return;
00319 
00320     ia64_fph_enable();
00321 }
00322 
00323 static inline void xnarch_init_root_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00324                                          struct xnthread *thread,
00325                                          const char *name)
00326 {
00327     tcb->user_task = current;
00328     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00329     tcb->espp = &tcb->esp;
00330     tcb->fpup = current->thread.fph;
00331 }
00332 
00333 static void xnarch_thread_trampoline (struct xnthread *self,
00334                                       int imask,
00335                                       void(*entry)(void *),
00336                                       void *cookie)
00337 {
00338     /* xnpod_welcome_thread() will do ia64_fpu_enable() if needed. */
00339     ia64_fph_disable();
00340     rthal_local_irq_restore(!!imask);
00341     rthal_local_irq_enable_hw();
00342     xnpod_welcome_thread(self);
00343     entry(cookie);
00344     xnpod_delete_thread(self);
00345 }
00346 
00347 static inline void xnarch_init_thread (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00348                                        void (*entry)(void *),
00349                                        void *cookie,
00350                                        int imask,
00351                                        struct xnthread *thread,
00352                                        char *name)
00353 {
00354     unsigned long rbs,bspstore,child_stack,child_rbs,rbs_size;
00355     unsigned long stackbase = (unsigned long) tcb->stackbase;
00356     struct switch_stack *swstack;    
00357 
00358     tcb->esp = 0;
00359     
00360     /* the stack should have already been allocated */   
00361     rthal_prepare_stack(stackbase+KERNEL_STACK_SIZE);
00362 
00363     /* The value of esp is used as a marker to indicate whether we are
00364        initializing a new task or we are back from the context switch. */
00365 
00366     if (tcb->esp != 0)
00367         xnarch_thread_trampoline(thread, imask, entry, cookie);
00368 
00369     child_stack = stackbase + KERNEL_STACK_SIZE - IA64_SWITCH_STACK_SIZE;
00370     tcb->esp = child_stack;
00371     swstack = (struct switch_stack *)child_stack;
00372     bspstore = swstack->ar_bspstore;
00373 
00374     rbs = (ia64_getreg(_IA64_REG_SP) & ~(KERNEL_STACK_SIZE-1)) + IA64_RBS_OFFSET;
00375     child_rbs = stackbase + IA64_RBS_OFFSET;
00376     rbs_size = bspstore - rbs;
00377 
00378     memcpy((void *)child_rbs,(void *)rbs,rbs_size);
00379     swstack->ar_bspstore = child_rbs + rbs_size;
00380     tcb->esp -= 16 ;    /* Provide for the (bloody) scratch area... */
00381 }
00382 
00383 #endif /* XENO_POD_MODULE */

00387 static inline void xnarch_init_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00388 {
00389     tcb->user_task = NULL;
00390     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00391     tcb->espp = &tcb->esp;
00392     tcb->fpup = tcb->fpuenv;
00393     /* Must be followed by xnarch_init_thread(). */
00394 }
00395 
00396 #endif /* XENO_THREAD_MODULE */

00400 static inline void xnarch_init_shadow_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00401                                            struct xnthread *thread,
00402                                            const char *name)
00403 {
00404     struct task_struct *task = current;
00405 
00406     tcb->user_task = task;
00407     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00408     tcb->esp = 0;
00409     tcb->espp = &task->thread.ksp;
00410     tcb->fpup = task->thread.fph;
00411 }

00413 static inline void xnarch_grab_xirqs (void (*handler)(unsigned irq))
00414 
00415 {
00416     unsigned irq;
00417 
00418     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00419         rthal_virtualize_irq(rthal_current_domain,
00420                              irq,
00421                              handler,
00422                              NULL,
00423                              IPIPE_DYNAMIC_MASK);
00424 }
00425 
00426 static inline void xnarch_lock_xirqs (adomain_t *adp, int cpuid)
00427 
00428 {
00429     unsigned irq;
00430 
00431     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00432         {
00433         unsigned vector = __ia64_local_vector_to_irq(irq);
00434 
00435         switch (vector)
00436             {
00437 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00438             case ADEOS_CRITICAL_VECTOR:
00439             case IA64_IPI_RESCHEDULE:
00440             case IA64_IPI_VECTOR:
00441 
00442                 /* Never lock out these ones. */
00443                 continue;
00444 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00445 
00446             default:
00447 
00448                 rthal_lock_irq(adp,cpuid,irq);
00449             }
00450         }
00451 }
00452 
00453 static inline void xnarch_unlock_xirqs (adomain_t *adp, int cpuid)
00454 
00455 {
00456     unsigned irq;
00457 
00458     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00459         {
00460         unsigned vector = local_vector_to_irq(irq);
00461 
00462         switch (vector)
00463             {
00464 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00465             case ADEOS_CRITICAL_VECTOR:
00466             case IA64_IPI_RESCHEDULE:
00467             case IA64_IPI_VECTOR:
00468 
00469                 continue;
00470 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00471 
00472             default:
00473 
00474                 rthal_unlock_irq(adp,irq);
00475             }
00476         }
00477 }
00478 
00479 #endif /* XENO_SHADOW_MODULE */

00505 #ifdef XENO_MAIN_MODULE

00507 #include <linux/init.h>

00510 extern u_long nkschedlat;
00511 
00512 extern u_long nktimerlat;
00513 
00514 int xnarch_escalation_virq;

00516 int xnpod_trap_fault(xnarch_fltinfo_t *fltinfo);
00517 
00518 void xnpod_schedule_handler(void);
00519 
00520 static rthal_trap_handler_t xnarch_old_trap_handler;
00521 
00522 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00523 static xnlock_t xnarch_stacks_lock = XNARCH_LOCK_UNLOCKED;
00524 #endif
00525 static atomic_counter_t xnarch_allocated_stacks;
00526 
00527 static xnarch_stack_t xnarch_free_stacks_q;
00528 static atomic_counter_t xnarch_free_stacks_count;
00529 
00530 static int xnarch_trap_fault (unsigned event, unsigned domid, void *data)
00531 {
00532     xnarch_fltinfo_t fltinfo;
00533 
00534     fltinfo.trap = event;
00535     fltinfo.ia64 = *(ia64trapinfo_t *)data;
00536 
00537     return xnpod_trap_fault(&fltinfo);
00538 }
00539 
00540 unsigned long xnarch_calibrate_timer (void)
00541 
00542 {
00543 #if CONFIG_XENO_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0
00544     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(CONFIG_XENO_HW_TIMER_LATENCY);
00545 #else /* CONFIG_XENO_HW_TIMER_LATENCY unspecified. */
00546     /* Compute the time needed to program the ITM in aperiodic
00547        mode. The return value is expressed in CPU ticks. */
00548     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(rthal_timer_calibrate()) ?: 1;
00549 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0 */
00550 }
00551 
00552 int xnarch_calibrate_sched (void)
00553 
00554 {
00555     nktimerlat = xnarch_calibrate_timer();
00556 
00557     if (!nktimerlat)
00558         return -ENODEV;
00559 
00560     nkschedlat = xnarch_ns_to_tsc(xnarch_get_sched_latency());
00561 
00562     return 0;
00563 }
00564 
00565 static inline void stacksq_push(xnarch_stack_t *q, xnarch_stack_t *stack)
00566 {
00567     stack->next = q->next;
00568     q->next = stack;
00569 }
00570 
00571 static inline xnarch_stack_t *stacksq_pop(xnarch_stack_t *q)
00572 {
00573     xnarch_stack_t *stack = q->next;
00574 
00575     if(stack)
00576         q->next = stack->next;
00577 
00578     return stack;
00579 }
00580 
00581 int xnarch_alloc_stack(xnarchtcb_t *tcb, unsigned stacksize)
00582 
00583 {
00584     xnarch_stack_t *stack;
00585     spl_t s;
00586 
00587     if (stacksize > KERNEL_STACK_SIZE)
00588         return -EINVAL;
00589 
00590     tcb->stacksize = stacksize;
00591 
00592     if (stacksize == 0) {
00593         tcb->stackbase = NULL;
00594         return 0;
00595     }
00596 
00597     if (rthal_current_domain == rthal_root_domain &&
00598         atomic_read(&xnarch_free_stacks_count) <= CONFIG_XENO_HW_IA64_STACK_POOL)
00599         {
00600         stack = (xnarch_stack_t *)
00601             __get_free_pages(GFP_KERNEL,KERNEL_STACK_SIZE_ORDER);
00602 
00603         if(stack)
00604             atomic_inc(&xnarch_allocated_stacks);
00605 
00606         goto done;
00607         }
00608 
00609     xnlock_get_irqsave(&xnarch_stacks_lock, s);
00610     stack = stacksq_pop(&xnarch_free_stacks_q);
00611     xnlock_put_irqrestore(&xnarch_stacks_lock, s);
00612 
00613     if (stack)
00614         atomic_dec(&xnarch_free_stacks_count);
00615 
00616  done:
00617 
00618     tcb->stackbase = stack;
00619 
00620     return stack ? 0 : -ENOMEM;
00621 }
00622 
00623 void xnarch_free_stack(xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00624 
00625 {
00626     xnarch_stack_t *stack = tcb->stackbase;
00627     spl_t s;
00628 
00629     if (!stack)
00630         return;
00631 
00632     if (rthal_current_domain == rthal_root_domain
00633         && atomic_read(&xnarch_free_stacks_count) > CONFIG_XENO_HW_IA64_STACK_POOL)
00634         {
00635         atomic_dec(&xnarch_allocated_stacks);
00636         free_pages((unsigned long) stack,KERNEL_STACK_SIZE_ORDER);
00637         return;
00638         }
00639 
00640     xnlock_get_irqsave(&xnarch_stacks_lock, s);
00641     stacksq_push(&xnarch_free_stacks_q, stack);
00642     xnlock_put_irqrestore(&xnarch_stacks_lock, s);
00643     
00644     atomic_inc(&xnarch_free_stacks_count);
00645 }
00646 
00647 static int xnarch_stack_pool_init(void)
00648 
00649 {
00650     while (atomic_read(&xnarch_free_stacks_count) < CONFIG_XENO_HW_IA64_STACK_POOL)
00651         {
00652         xnarchtcb_t tcb; /* Fake TCB only to allocate and recycle stacks. */
00653 
00654         if (xnarch_alloc_stack(&tcb,KERNEL_STACK_SIZE))
00655             return -ENOMEM;
00656 
00657         xnarch_free_stack(&tcb);
00658         }
00659 
00660     return 0;
00661 }
00662 
00663 static void xnarch_stack_pool_destroy(void)
00664 
00665 {
00666     xnarch_stack_t *stack;
00667 
00668     stack = stacksq_pop(&xnarch_free_stacks_q);
00669 
00670     while (stack)
00671         {
00672         free_pages((unsigned long) stack, KERNEL_STACK_SIZE_ORDER);
00673         stack = stacksq_pop(&xnarch_free_stacks_q);
00674 
00675         if(atomic_dec_and_test(&xnarch_allocated_stacks))
00676             break;
00677         }
00678 
00679     if (atomic_read(&xnarch_allocated_stacks) != 0)
00680         xnarch_logwarn("leaked %u kernel threads stacks.\n",
00681                        atomic_read(&xnarch_allocated_stacks));
00682 
00683     if (xnarch_free_stacks_q.next)
00684         xnarch_logwarn("kernel threads stacks pool corrupted.\n");
00685 }
00686 
00687 static inline int xnarch_init (void)
00688 
00689 {
00690     int err;
00691 
00692 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00693     /* The HAL layer also sets the same CPU affinity so that both
00694        modules keep their execution sequence on SMP boxen. */
00695     set_cpus_allowed(current,cpumask_of_cpu(0));
00696 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00697 
00698     err = xnarch_calibrate_sched();
00699 
00700     if (err)
00701         return err;
00702 
00703     xnarch_escalation_virq = rthal_alloc_virq();
00704 
00705     if (xnarch_escalation_virq == 0)
00706         return -ENOSYS;
00707 
00708     rthal_virtualize_irq(&rthal_domain,
00709                          xnarch_escalation_virq,
00710                          (void (*)(unsigned))&xnpod_schedule_handler,
00711                          NULL,
00712                          IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00713 
00714     xnarch_old_trap_handler = rthal_trap_catch(&xnarch_trap_fault);
00715 
00716 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_OPT_PERVASIVE
00717     err = xnshadow_mount();
00718 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_OPT_PERVASIVE */
00719 
00720     if (err)
00721         goto release_trap;
00722 
00723     err = xnarch_stack_pool_init();
00724 
00725     if (!err)
00726         return 0;
00727 
00728 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_OPT_PERVASIVE
00729     xnshadow_cleanup();
00730 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_OPT_PERVASIVE */
00731 
00732  release_trap:
00733     rthal_trap_catch(xnarch_old_trap_handler);
00734     rthal_free_virq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00735 
00736     return err;
00737 }
00738 
00739 static inline void xnarch_exit (void)
00740 
00741 {
00742 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_OPT_PERVASIVE
00743     xnshadow_cleanup();
00744 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_OPT_PERVASIVE */
00745     rthal_trap_catch(xnarch_old_trap_handler);
00746     rthal_free_virq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00747     xnarch_stack_pool_destroy();
00748 }
00749 
00750 #endif /* XENO_MAIN_MODULE */
00751 
00752 #ifdef __cplusplus
00753 }
00754 #endif
00755 
00756 #else /* !__KERNEL__ */
00757 
00758 #include <nucleus/system.h>
00759 #include <bits/local_lim.h>
00760 
00761 #endif /* __KERNEL__ */
00762 
00763 #endif /* !_XENO_ASM_IA64_SYSTEM_H */
